instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works on external (more GPU woes)
threads.message:
Not that interested in weather or not this actually gets fixed.
But i have a 2915 here that i fitted a GPU to (6750M)

The original symtom was no display internal and hangs on boots (external) 

Ive got it all running on external, but the internal doesnt get recognised. LVDS looks clean, checked with a known good assembley, <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is not present, But <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> does get to the screen.
Im only getting a bit wound up by this as its running stress tests perfectly and responding completely normally other than the lack of display on internal.
Is there anything to check?
Its worth noting that <CHIP>U9500</CHIP> had been replaced prior to me getting the machine. Im hoping its not the gmux or a PCB issue

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works on external (more GPU woes)
threads.message: Uhm, tried a known good LCD/LCD cable. Inspected connector for damage?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works on external (more GPU woes)
threads.message: Yes, Ive used a known good screen assembly. The LVDS connector looks undamaged with no corrosion, ive also inspected the inside of the connector for burns. Everything is clean, so im doubtful its the LVDS connector

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works on external (more GPU woes)
threads.message: Follow <SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>LVDS_EG_DDC</SIGNAL>. These data lines will recognize the LCD. Check diode measurement too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works on external (more GPU woes)
threads.message:
It was the LVDS despite it looking perfect inside and out. 
New LVDS connector solved the problem.
